activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew S Stoner

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.

11:43 AM Defendant Matthew S Stoner appeared by phone as the video in zoom was dropped.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Kaitlin Elizabeth Dippolito in court for Matthew S Stoner for today only.  Attorney Dippolito relates there is a conflict with their office and requests reset.  AIA reset and may appear by zoom.  Address and phone number confirmed.  Bond continues.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

11:11 AM Defendant Matthew S Stoner in court.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant qualifies for Public Defender services but counsel has not yet been assigned.\
Reset before Judge Bitney.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

10:45 AM Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew S Stoner in court. Atty. Michael Steuer appears by zoom video for today only.

Counsel has not yet been assigned.
AIA set.
Bond to continue.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473. 

Must have no contact with D.M., C.S., S.W.

12:59 PM Prosecuting attorney Brady James Seidlitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Matthew S Stoner appeared by video. Attorney Dustin Rockow appears on behalf of the Public Defenders Office for today only. Defendant must call the public defender's office to determine eligibility.  If the defendant does not qualify for public defender representation, the defendant must complete a Petition for Appointment of an Attorney, Affidavit of Indigency also known as the blue form in order for the court to consider appointing an attorney. Defendant to appear with counsel at the next hearing. Parties in a break out room.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
